scenarios.label: Baseline / Recommended
scenarios.description: Production-ready internet-facing web app using Azure Front Door with WAF, App Service, Azure SQL DB, Azure Cache for Redis, Blob Storage, private endpoints for DB and storage, and standard monitoring and backup.

resources.notes: Single production VNet with subnets for private endpoints and integration with App Service via regional VNet integration. No direct VNet cost but needed for private endpoints.
Azure Front Door Premium with WAF enabled for global entry point, SSL offload, and path-based routing to App Service. Egress_gb approximates outbound data to internet clients.

Premium v3 App Service Plan (Linux) with 2 instances for HA across zones. Storage_gb is for App Service content and logs. Egress_gb approximates outbound traffic from App Service to internet and other services.
resources.product_name: Azure App Service Premium v3 Plan - Linux

sku_candidates.product_name: Azure App Service Premium v3 Plan - Linux
Azure App Service Premium v4 Plan - Linux
Azure App Service Premium v2 Plan - Linux
Azure App Service Premium v4 Plan
Azure App Service Premium v3 Plan

resources.notes: Web App running on the Premium v3 App Service Plan. No separate SKU cost beyond the plan; included here for clarity of logical application resource.
resources.product_name: Web App (logical, billed via App Service Plan)

resources.notes: Azure SQL Database General Purpose Gen5 with 4 vCores, zone redundant where available. Storage includes data and log. Reserved capacity assumed for cost optimization in steady-state production.
resources.product_name: SQL Database Single/Elastic Pool General Purpose - Compute Gen5

sku_candidates.product_name: SQL Database Single/Elastic Pool General Purpose - Compute Gen5
SQL Database Single/Elastic Pool General Purpose - Compute Gen5
SQL Database SingleDB/Elastic Pool Hyperscale - Compute Gen5
SQL Database Single/Elastic Pool Business Critical - Compute Gen5

resources.error: Reservation unit of measure looks hourly/monthly; treated as ambiguous

resources.notes: Standard C1 Redis cache for session/state caching and hot data. Includes primary and replica. Throughput and operations sized for moderate traffic web app.

General-purpose v2 storage account with Blob service. GRS for durability. Hot tier for frequently accessed content, Cool and Archive for older data. Egress_gb approximates downloads to clients via Front Door.
resources.meter_name: Hot Data Returned for Query Acceleration, Cool Data Scanned for Query Acceleration, Archive Data Write
resources.product_name: Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 Hierarchical Namespace, Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 Hierarchical Namespace, Blob Storage

sku_candidates.meter_name: Cool Data Scanned for Query Acceleration
sku_candidates.product_name: Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 Hierarchical Namespace

resources.notes: Private Endpoint for Azure SQL DB in the main VNet. Billed as Private Link endpoint; enables private access from App Service via VNet integration.
Private Endpoint for Blob Storage in the main VNet. Used for secure access from App Service and other internal components.
NAT Gateway for outbound internet access from resources in the VNet (e.g., for updates, external APIs). Egress_gb approximates outbound traffic.
resources.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

sku_candidates.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

resources.notes: Standard public IP associated with NAT Gateway for outbound connectivity.
Key Vault for secrets, keys, and certificates used by App Service and other components. Standard tier assumed.
Log Analytics workspace for App Service, SQL diagnostics, and platform logs. Storage_gb approximates 30 days of hot retention; archive_gb for longer-term retention.
Recovery Services vault for backups of SQL DB (via long-term retention) and potentially App Service content. Storage_gb sized for multiple restore points.

scenarios.label: Cost Optimized
scenarios.description: Lower-cost variant using Standard Front Door, smaller App Service and SQL tiers, smaller Redis and storage, and reduced redundancy while keeping private endpoints.

resources.notes: Single VNet for private endpoints and App Service VNet integration. No direct cost.
Azure Front Door Standard with WAF policies; lower capacity and traffic assumptions than baseline.
Standard S1 App Service Plan (Linux) with single instance. Lower HA and performance but cheaper; suitable for lower traffic or non-critical workloads.

resources.notes: Web App running on Standard S1 plan. Logical resource only.
resources.product_name: Web App (logical, billed via App Service Plan)

resources.notes: Azure SQL Database General Purpose Gen5 with 2 vCores. Lower compute and storage than baseline; reserved capacity for savings.

scenarios.label: High Performance / Scalable
scenarios.description: Higher performance and scalability with Front Door Premium, larger App Service plan with more instances, higher-tier SQL DB, larger Redis, and more storage and egress capacity.

resources.notes: Main VNet with subnets sized for more private endpoints and potential future scale-out.
Front Door Premium with WAF for high traffic, advanced routing, and security. Higher egress and request volume.
Premium v3 P2 App Service Plan (Linux) with 4 instances for high throughput and resilience. Reserved instances assumed for cost efficiency at scale.

NAT Gateway sized for higher outbound traffic to external services and updates.
